Class PixelToDoubleCartesian

java.lang.Object
com.graph.PixelToDoubleCartesian
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConvertCoordinate<Double,Double>
public class PixelToDoubleCartesian extends Object implements ConvertCoordinate<Double,Double>
Converts image-space coordinates to their equivalent positions in the Cartesian plane using double-precision arithmetic.

This class enables the mapping of pixel locations (represented as doubles) to Cartesian coordinates for use in high-precision graphical applications, such as fractal rendering. It supports various construction methods based on plane bounds, center points, or magnification factors.

Instances of this class are immutable and tailored to specific image dimensions and scaling ratios. The use of double precision allows sub-pixel accuracy, making it suitable for applications requiring anti-aliasing or smooth zooming.

Version:
1.0, 2025-06-10
Author:
George Miller

    • createFromMinMax

      public static PixelToDoubleCartesian createFromMinMax(double minX, double maxX, double minY, double maxY, int width, int height)
      Create a new instance of PixelToDoubleCartesian from the minimum and maximum x and y coordinates of the plane that the fractal is being rendered in and the dimensions of the image it is being rendered on.
      Parameters:
      minX - Minimum x-coordinate.
      maxX - Minimum x-coordinate.
      minY - Minimum y-coordinate.
      maxY - Maximum y-coordinate.
      width - Width of the image the fractal is being rendered in.
      height - Height of the image the fractal is being rendered in.
      Returns:
      New instance of PixelToDoubleCartesian.

    • createFromCenterPlaneWidth

      public static PixelToDoubleCartesian createFromCenterPlaneWidth(double xCenter, double yCenter, double planeWidth, int width, int height)
      Create a new instance of PixelToDoubleCartesian from the center coordinate and the width of the graph shown on image (maxX - minX).
      Parameters:
      xCenter - The x-coordinate of the center of the plane.
      yCenter - The y-coordinate of the center of the plane.
      planeWidth - The width of the plane.
      width - Width of the image the fractal is being rendered in.
      height - Height of the image the fractal is being rendered in.
      Returns:
      New instance of PixelToDoubleCartesian.

    • createFromMagnification

      public static PixelToDoubleCartesian createFromMagnification(double xCenter, double yCenter, double magnification, int width, int height)
      Create a new instance of PixelToDoubleCartesian from the center coordinate and a magnification factor. A magnification of 1 gives a plane width of 4.
      Parameters:
      xCenter - The x-coordinate of the center of the plane.
      yCenter - The y-coordinate of the center of the plane.
      magnification - Magnification of the graph area relative to the first frame, which has a width of 4.
      width - Width of the image the fractal is being rendered in.
      height - Height of the image the fractal is being rendered in.
      Returns:
      New instance of PixelToDoubleCartesian.
